body: @jboeuf Do you know what might cause this?

Just scanning through quickly, you don't have to specify ca.pem on the
server side as this could be a hint that you are expecting a client
certificate (which is not configured).
Let me know if that doesn't work and I can have a quick look at the certs.

On Fri, Feb 17, 2017 at 8:38 AM, Michael Lumish <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> @jboeuf <https://github.com/jboeuf> Do you know what might cause this?
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/9761#issuecomment-280700024>, or mute
> the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AF-P7cgsMdJfd1cecc0qANXZyJ13BjUiks5rdczugaJpZM4MEcYK>
> .
>

Perfect, I passed null for the first parameter of ServerCredentials.createSsl and did not pass any arguments to credentials.createSsl -- worked like a charm

Thanks so much for the super quick response

Awesome. Thanks much for letting us know!
